title: Australia v England: Ashes second Test, day four – live
summary: England faces an uphill battle in Brisbane as they require a miraculous performance to turn the tide of the match. Follow our writers for live updates from the Gabba. Stay tuned for all the action as the situation unfolds.

title: ‘No one knows where it came from’: first wild beaver spotted in Norfolk for 400 years
summary: A solitary creature was spotted gathering materials for its lodge in a riverside nature reserve. Cameras installed in the area captured this intriguing behavior. The footage highlights the unique wildlife and ecological activities within the reserve.

title: Christmas dinner in a restaurant or kitchen carnage at home?
summary: The author reflects on their experiences dining at restaurants, indicating a mix of enjoyment and hesitation. Despite multiple outings, they remain uncertain about fully embracing the dining-out experience. The piece captures the complexity of navigating social eating in the current climate.

title: ‘What’s my life like away from rugby? Chaos’: Red Rose superstar Ellie Kildunne on confidence, cowboy dances and why it’s cool to be different
summary: Kildunne is celebrated not only for her remarkable speed and impressive tries in rugby but also for her diverse interests outside of the sport. Alongside her athletic prowess, she has a passion for photography and has ventured into DIY tattooing. This multifaceted talent showcases her creativity beyond the rugby field.

title: ‘What choice do we have?’: no end in sight for Ukraine’s war-weary frontline troops
summary: As peace negotiations stall, infantry soldiers are enduring extended deployments, increasing their exposure to life-threatening situations amid ongoing Russian offensives. The situation highlights the escalating risks faced by troops on the frontlines. Prospects for resolving the conflict remain bleak.
